name: Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Review all drawings and documentation provided to the Contractor.
Acceptance Criteria - Prior to the commencement of Works it must be ensure that all necessary documentation has been provided.
Frequency - Prior to the commencement of Works
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Footpaths and steps are provisional items and shall only be constructed if approved by the Engineer. Specs 1230: 27
Frequency - Prior to the commencement of construction of any footpath or steps

Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - All setting out shall be performed by or under the control of a licensed surveyor, who shall certify the accuracy of key dimensions of the as constructed works. Specs 1000: 3.2.4
Acceptance Criteria - Levels and allignment Set Out matches marks shown on the Drawings, 2D data and linework provided or agreed with the Engineer
Verifying Document - Compliance surveys or spot checks
Frequency - Prior to the commencement of Works
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Physically locate the services inside and close to the alignment area and levels depth. Specs 1131: 15.2.1
Acceptance Criteria - All services identified in B4UDig, plans and mark outs has been physically located
Verifying Document - Plans Mark out, photos
Frequency - Prior to the commencement of Works

Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Borrow pits are generally a hole dug in the ground from which material is removed and used on the track. Dept. of Consevation Track Construction and Maintenance Guidelines: 13.4, 13.7
Acceptance Criteria - Local Materail is any of the following:
Frequency - Prior to the commencement of Works
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - The material obtained from site celarance must be dumped at an approved location outside the Site. Specs 1100: 5.1
Acceptance Criteria - Location approved by the Engineer
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - No tree shall be cut down until the Engineer has given written authorisation for such work to commence. Specs 1100: 6.2

Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Topsoil shall be stockpiled in areas approved by the Engineer for this purpose. stockpiling operations must ensure the maximum utilisation of each area. Specs 1110: 9.4, TNZ F/1 Clause 4
Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Contaminated soils (Type H materials) encountered shall be treated and/or disposed off site in accordance with statutory requirements. Specs 1110: 9.3
Acceptance Criteria - Dumping site approval for contamiantion type
Frequency - If constaminated soils are found

Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - The Contractor shall inspect all set out prior to construction to confirm that the 2D linework has been interpreted appropriately to achieve the line and level of the finished works. Specs 1000: 3.2.4
Acceptance Criteria - Levels and allignment Set Out matches marks shown on the Drawings, Design, 2D data and linework provided or agreed with the Engineer
Verifying Document - Compliance surveys or spot checks
Frequency - During and at the end of the Excavation
4.6 - Cut and Fill Foot path Construction

Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Cut and fill construction involves cutting into the uphill sideslope and placing fill on the downhill slope. Depending of the sideslope. Dept. of Consevation Track Construction and Maintenance Guidelines: 13.1, 13.2
Acceptance Criteria - Sideslope > 25° (50%), Cut Construction. Sideslope Between 6° - 25° (10% - 47%), Only Cut Construction.
Verifying Document - Compliance surveys or spot checks

Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Compaction may be checked when undertaking fill formation work. All fill material needs to be compacted in layers no greater than 250 mm (prior to compaction). Dept. of Consevation Track Construction and Maintenance Guidelines: 13.2, 13.5

Acceptance Criteria - The Dynamic Cone Penetrometre can be used to indicate the compaction of soil and/or fill materials. If a large number of blows is needed to cause the cone to penetrate a short distance the soil/material is well compacted
Verifying Document - Dynamic Cone Penetrometre Checksheet
Frequency - After compaction of fill layer

Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Two hard copies and one electronic copy of As-built drawings shall be prepared in draft and final versions following Schedule 1D in NZS4404:2010. Specs 1000: 3.9.2

Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - All surplus, redundant and faulty materials must be removed from the Site and dispose of them in a safe and legal manner. Any demolition material or rubbish coming from the execution of the project must be removed as well. Specs 1000: 3.13.2

Inspection Point: Quality Control Activity - Completed items of construction about to be placed in service or occupied for their intended use must be properly and thoroughly cleaned of all foreign matter and other debris. Specs 1000: 3.13.3
